page.title: 19LOCAL SUPERNATURAL TALES
page.content: {"OLD WILLUM"} STOKESBY IS A SMALLISH VILLAGE AT THE EASTERN END OF THE D-BLOCK.IT LIES BY THE SIDE OF THE RIVER BURE ON THE APPROACHES TO YARMOUTH,AND IS A POPULAR MOORING PLACE FOR HOLIDAY MAKERS ON THE BROADS.IN SUCH MOORINGS THROUGHOUT BROADLAND,IT IS NOT UNUSUAL FOR A LOCAL PENSIONER TO APPOINT HIMSELF "HARBOUR MASTER",ACCEPTING LINES AND MAKING THEM FAST IN RETURN FOR A FEW COPPERS.HOLIDAY MAKERS PULLING INTO STOKESBY AS DUSK APPROACHES HAVE THEREFORE NOT BEEN SURPRISED TO HEAR A WEATHER-BEATEN ELDERLY MAN IN SEA-JERSEY AND BATTERED YACHTING CAP HAILING THEM FROM THE STAITHE.THEY ARE USUALLY MORE AMAZED TO FIND THAT THIS WELL-KNOWN LOCAL FIGURE PASSED AWAY SOME 60 YEARS AGO! THIS IS TAKEN BY LOCALS TO BE THE ULTIMATE IN DEVOTION TO DUTY!
